# But in reality: .tiny[(based on Vdem data)]

--

```{r, fig.width=14, fig.height=7.25, fig.align='center', cache=TRUE}

library(vdemdata) 
library(dplyr)
library(ggplot2)

data <- vdem %>% select("country_id", "country_name", "year",
                "v2x_polyarchy")

data %>% 
  ggplot(aes(x=year, y=v2x_polyarchy)) +
  geom_line(alpha = 0.25, 
            aes(group=factor(country_id),
                fill='gray')) +
  geom_smooth(se=F, color='red') +
  theme_minimal() +
  labs(y="democracy") +
  theme(legend.position = 'none',
        text = element_text(size=20))

```

# Events that lead to (or are related with) Revolutions

.content-box-green[.Large[Often .pink[misconstrued] as revolutions, but .red[not] revolutions themselves]]

--

- .Large[peasant revolts]

--

- .Large[grain riots]

--

- .Large[strikes]

--

- .Large[other social movements (sit-ins, marches, boycotts)]

--

- .Large[reform attempts/movements]

--

.Large[Some (but not all) of these  almost always happen <br> before revolutions, coups, or civil wars]

# The underlying factors (.tiny[explaining changes or lack thereof])

--

### Modernization theory (economic development)
--

- .large[ancient, but still powerful, explanation]

--

### Inequality (class conflict)
--

- .large[traditional explanation]
--

- .large[disregard .pink[elites]' strategic transactions; .orange[collective action]; regime performance]

--

### New(er) explanations
--

- .large[political institutions and grievance (inclusiveness; closedness)]

--
- .large[social organizations]

--
- .large[short-term economic shocks (e.g., crises)]

--
- .large[foreign interventions]

--
- .large[c.f., *weak democracy syndrome*]
